content.description: This is a short but fun line that climbs the dark-streaked wall on the climbers' right side. Start up and right but move left at horizontal and below the bolt. Climb the thin face past the 2 (or 3?) bolts to the anchor below the bushes.

This one likes to seep (drool) but after a little dry spell it's good to go. Climb cool face past the bolt to the horizontal crack ( gear here) and traverse right under the roof. Make a big move though powerful slopers to access the slab above. Short, powerful, and sweet.
content.protection: Bolts except one piece of gear in the big horizontal crack.

content.description: A nice bouldery route with some awesome slabbing.  Start on some easy terrain under the roof.  Clip a bolt and then place excellent gear under the roof.  Figure out how to clip the next bolt (quite high, but can be done).  Shake it out and fire the roof into the slab sequence.  There is a small quartz crystal that makes this move possible.  It seems very solid, but best not to use for a foot (not really needed at that point anyway).  Clip another bolt and make more slab moves to easier ground.  Anchors on the top.
content.protection: A couple hand size cams, 3 bolts, anchors.
content.location: On the rock just left of Bow and Narrow.  Starts under the roof.

content.description: Slab up into crack. Jam and lay back crack up to where it turns to super thin flake. Be smart with protection here.  Mantle horizontal, clip bolt, slab to two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Trad, one bolt at top, two bolt anchor
content.location: On the left side of the Archetype Wall.

content.description: A thin start gains a seam and the first bolt. From here undercling the big thin flake up and right past another bolt and some knob climbing to gain the diagonal "crack". Optional gear here. Clip a bolt above on the face and move left along the foot ledge to the large groove. Follow the groove past bolts (might need to sling long) to a ledge below the easy slab. Climb this slab past one last bolt to the anchor in the boulder up and right of the tree.
content.protection: 6 or 7 bolts and an optional finger/hand size cam (0.5 camalot ?)
content.location: Middle-right of the south face. Starts from the lowest point of the rock.

content.description: This is the short steep wall down and climbers' left of the Arch Wall. Much of it is blank but there are a few worthy routes and very easy access from the other areas.
